New Records: West Indies set a new unwanted record of 51 dot balls - the most any team has registered in a T20 World Cup when posting a score of at least 180.
Key Match Events: Phil Salt scored 87 not out, leading England to victory.
Jonny Bairstow scored an unbeaten 48, contributing significantly to the win.
A 97-run stand between Salt and Bairstow was pivotal in England's chase.
Rovman Powell hit five sixes in his innings.
Jofra Archer removed Nicholas Pooran caught behind.
Adil Rashid took the big wicket of Andre Russell.
Phil Salt's assault on Romario Shepherd, striking the seamer for 30 runs in one over, was a key moment.
Post-Match Reflections: Phil Salt expressed happiness about Jonny Bairstow taking the pressure off him by taking calculated risks.
West Indies coach Sammy stated that the loss will not dampen their spirits.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played on a fine batting deck at the Daren Sammy National Stadium.
England's pursuit began steadily, reaching 58 for no loss after six overs.
Jofra Archer was consistently around the 90mph mark.
